Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Small globular vase. The base is flat with a light swelling. The orifice, which is wide and without a neck, ends in a vertical lip. The clay is fine, compact and orange and has a tendency to flake. The vase has been polished, the shoulder decorated with two wavy lines filled with white paste. Four holes under the lip demonstrate that this vessel was suspended.
